text: I personally believe uh that we are
already today over regulated and I'm
talking now here about the real economy
I'm not talking about the financial
industry which is a different
discussion uh I have pointed out in
public and I have pointed out to the
most important politicians of this world
that whatever they are doing now G20
don't
forget that this crisis has not been
provoked by the real economy this crisis
has made the real economy a victim of
the financial crisis and not the other
way around we have enough regulation
after Enron I have at that time said I
think we are already over regulated
doesn't make any sense to have n th
pages of Regulation how you run a
company we would rather have some very
good principles and live up to these
principles than to have this over
regulated things which at the end of the
day has not has not prevented any other
crisis so yes it has it has provoked
that the productivity since this
overregulation has come into into into
life if you look at the productivity of
the real economy it has gone back back
because sports management have been more
occupied with complying with regulation
than with increasing productivity and
increasing the living standard of the
consumers I think we already over
regulated we don't need more we need
less regulation today and we should be
refocusing what I think the real economy
is all about which is creating wealth
and Better Living standard for our
consumers all over the world regulations
will never ever
prevent fraud or criminal
Behavior because if that was the case we
wouldn't have them now because we have
laws we have regulation and things like
this so to think that you can regulate
every single thing and with this you
would have human beings behaving in a
perfect manner is this is not realistic
okay so what you really have to do is to
come back and to think what is the most
important part of
governance now it is my personal opinion
that the most important part if I'm
talking now about corporate governance
is to establish a very strong a very
strong basically uh board of
directors I don't
believe that an so-called shareholder
shareholder
democracy is the right answer to that I
don't think the shareholders and the
whole whole setup are
being conceived in order to
exercise the Control Function that's why
we have a board of directors and it is
not because one or the other board of
directors has not been working or
whether there were issues of what I
would call internal corruption or things
like this that therefore the model
doesn't work I think our model is still
working very well you have the
shareholders who have the ultimate
responsibility they exercise this
ultimate responsibility through their
voting rights which they should be using
strongly and consciously and then
afterwards delegate the power of the of
the Control Function and the execution
function to a strong to a strong board
and if the board is not behaving well
you always have the possibility to
eliminate uh the port members you don't
have to reelect the port members
so I think strengthening of the board
not weakening of the board is one of the
crucial elements of what we where we
should be going into the future
